intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: How should we explain yesterday to Sothe and Nolan?

intro.speaker: Leonardo
intro.line: It's like you said. We didn't have a choice. We had to save Nico and the townsfolk. But I admit, getting spotted by those Begnion soldiers was unfortunate. Still, I'd do it all over again. The worst part is they know we're near. They could find this hideout as easily as they found our last one.

intro.speaker: Edward
intro.line: I just don't get it. This is our country... Why do we have to live in hiding, like prisoners in our own land?

intro.speaker: Leonardo
intro.line: Come on, you know why. We lost the war...and Crimea won. It's not "our" country anymore. End of story.

intro.speaker: Edward
intro.line: Except that Crimea walked away after winning, leaving those heartless Begnion dogs to rule our country for the last three years! The occupying soldiers march around like they own the place, doing whatever they want, and no one dares to stop them!
To be fair, Crimea didn't have the resources to rule another country.

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: Sothe! And Nolan, too! Welcome back. I'm glad you made it in one piece.

intro.speaker: Leonardo
intro.line: At last, the Dawn Brigade is all present. But you are unusually late. Were you delayed?

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: I think our fame's catching up with us. Begnion patrols are everywhere. It took us a while to avoid them.

intro.speaker: Nolan
intro.line: I've never seen so much Begnion activity in this area before. Is there...something we should know?

intro.speaker: Leonardo
intro.line: Um, well, actually, the truth is...

intro.speaker: Nolan
intro.line: Ah, that's what did it. You had a run-in with bandits?

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: And Begnion soldiers spotted us as we made our escape. I'm sorry. We only wanted to help. We were careless.

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: We'll worry about that later. More importantly, Micaiah, were you seen healing anyone with Sacrifice?

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: I'm afraid so.

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: You can't allow anyone to know what you can do. Healing without any tomes or staves is a rare gift—-almost unheard of. If anyone saw you doing it, you'd be given away immediately, and I don't know if I could keep you safe.

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: I know, Sothe.

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: I know you know, but you keep doing it! This place isn't safe anymore. We should leave at once.

intro.speaker: Nolan
intro.line: Correct. Ah, but it would have been nice to eat just one meal in peace...

intro.speaker: Edward
intro.line: This way's no good either. Begnion soldiers have every alleyway blocked. A kitten couldn't sneak past them.

intro.speaker: Nolan
intro.line: It looks like this really is the least guarded path, then. Even so, it's swarming with soldiers.

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: There are more coming up behind us! We'll be trapped if we don't move quickly!

intro.speaker: Nolan
intro.line: We can't wait for Sothe.

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: The stairs by the church lead to the marketplace. We can break through there.

intro.speaker: Nolan
intro.line: I'll go first and secure the way. Micaiah and Leonardo, cover my back! Remember to keep your distance from the enemy. Team up and bring them down one by one!

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: We'll be careful.

intro.speaker: Leonardo
intro.line: Leave it to us.

intro.speaker: Nolan
intro.line: Edward, you bring up the rear. Your skills have improved, but you're still new to fighting. Don't rush the enemy. Just focus on surviving their attacks. Got it?

intro.speaker: Edward
intro.line: Yeah, yeah, I got it.

battle.speaker: Mercenary
battle.line: Captain Isaiya! Just as you said. A group that appears to be the Dawn Brigade is storming the alley!

battle.speaker: Isaiya
battle.line: How generous of them. I'll wipe them out and advertise my exploits to our commanders back home.

visit.speaker: Grandmother
visit.line: You there! You must be... Ah, you needn't say a word. I see the goodwill in your eyes. Take this and go, quickly. You've done so much for Daein's poor. It's time we did something in return.

visit.speaker: Man
visit.line: Those beasts! They do whatever they want in our country. They're even sending our clergy to their awful camps! But I'm helpless. I don't have your strength or courage. This axe... You should have it.

boss.speaker: Isaiya
boss.line: What fast little mice you are! How long do you plan on scurrying around in back alleys?

boss.speaker: Isaiya
boss.line: What?! This can't be! I'm in my prime... Not...so easily...

boss.speaker: Isaiya
boss.line: The girl we've been looking for! The lucky little escapee. Too bad for you, sweetie. Your luck ends today!

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: Everybody...this way!

end.speaker: Begnion
end.line: They're running to the center of town! After them!

end.speaker: Nolan
end.line: Good work! I see the market. If we can blend into the crowd, they'll lose us, and we'll be free and clear.

end.speaker: Nico
end.line: Hey, lady!

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Nico!

end.speaker: Lady
end.line: They're after you again, aren't they?

end.speaker: Nico
end.line: Are you and your friends all right?

end.speaker: Begnion
end.line: Moldy onions! Where'd they go?!

end.speaker: Grandfather
end.line: Leave the soldiers to us. Go on, now. Get yourselves to safety.

end.speaker: Lady
end.line: Quickly—-don't dawdle. You must escape. You're our only hope.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Thank you so much!

end.speaker: Begnion
end.line: Wait! There they go! Catch them!

end.speaker: Begnion
end.line: What are you stopping for?

end.speaker: Begnion
end.line: W-well, they...

end.speaker: Lady
end.line: You won't get past us! We stand by the Dawn Brigade.

end.speaker: Nico
end.line: That's right! Goddess protect the Dawn Brigade!

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Wait! Something terrible is about to happen!

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: What is it?

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: ...No! We have to go back.

end.speaker: Begnion
end.line: What?! You're letting this rabble stop you? Ready your bows! Nobody defies the will of Begnion.

end.speaker: Grandmother
end.line: No! How could you shoot a child? You vicious savages!

end.speaker: Lady
end.line: Someone! Someone, help him, quickly! Please...this child is dying!

end.speaker: Begnion
end.line: Pay heed! This is what happens when you meddle in Begnion affairs of state. Remember it well!

end.speaker: Man
end.line: I didn't realize that the Begnion Empire's affairs of state included murdering children in the street!

end.speaker: Begnion
end.line: Don't point your fingers at us. We're just doing our job. If you're upset, blame the Dawn Brigade! They made this happen!

end.speaker: Begnion
end.line: It's the girl we're looking for! Call for reinforcements! Surround and arrest every last one of them...

end.speaker: Begnion
end.line: What's happening?! What does she think she's doing?! Hey, you, step away from that child!

end.speaker: Grandfather
end.line: It...it's a miracle. We've seen a miracle today!

end.speaker: Man
end.line: That was Sacrifice...

end.speaker: Lady
end.line: That girl! She must be the Silver-Haired Maiden. Only she possesses Sacrifice!

end.speaker: Begnion
end.line: Stop right there! After them! We can't let them get away!

end.speaker: Man
end.line: We still stand by the Dawn Brigade.

end.speaker: Begnion
end.line: What is wrong with you people?! Did you hear me?! Clear a path, or you'll end up like that kid!

end.speaker: Jarod
end.line: You sniveling idiots! Why are you just standing there?! Give chase. Now!

end.speaker: Begnion
end.line: Yes, sir! We would like to, sir, but...the townspeople are blocking our way.

end.speaker: Jarod
end.line: Oh...I see. The townspeople are blocking your way. You dullards!

end.speaker: Jarod
end.line: Clean out those dirty ears and listen to me! You are soldiers, and I am your commander! You will follow my orders promptly and without hesitation. Understand, you useless vermin? Now, move!

end.speaker: Jarod
end.line: Unbelievable! If it's not one thing, it's another. Why am I always stuck leading the buffoons?

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: Are you awake now? Thank goodness. Do you see? This is why I told you not to use Sacrifice...

end.speaker: Edward
end.line: We sure showed them in Nevassa, huh? I guess we can't go back there... not for a while anyway.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: I'm so fond of Nevassa. It's where we all met. It feels like my only real home. We will return...someday.

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: We will, Micaiah. I know you, and you have a way of getting what you want.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Because you're always there to help me get it, Sothe.
